AbstractText.sentence: ompC expression in Escherichia coli K-12 is known to be regulated by the ompB locus, comprising the ompR and envZ genes, and the OmpR protein is believed to act as a positive transcriptional factor.

AbstractText.sentence: We examined the transcriptional capability of the ompC gene in vitro and found that RNA polymerase could transcribe ompC without a requirement for other transcriptional factors.

AbstractText.sentence: We employed oligonucleotide-directed site-specific mutagenesis to dissect the promoter region of the gene and assayed the promoters separately for transcriptional ability using fusions to the lacZ gene.
The levels of beta-galactosidase indicate that ompC expression in vivo is dependent on the function of at least one of the upstream promoters.
